title: Antiochis of Commagene
text:
Antiochis of Commagene () — was a Princess from the <a href="Kingdom%20of%20Commagene">Kingdom of Commagene</a>, who lived in the 1st century BC. She was of <a href="Greeks">Greek</a> and <a href="Iranian%20peoples">Iranian</a> descent.
Family.
Antiochis was the second daughter of King <a href="Antiochus%20I%20Theos%20of%20Commagene">Antiochus I Theos of Commagene</a> and Queen <a href="Isias">Isias</a> Philostorgos. Unfortunately very little is known on Antiochis. The identity of her husband is unknown and she had a daughter called Aka, also known as <a href="Aka%20I%20of%20Commagene">Aka I of Commagene</a>.
She appeared to have died of unknown causes sometime between the late 30s or early 20s BC. Antiochis was buried along with her mother and her daughter on a burial site known as the "Karakush" or "<a href="Karaku%C5%9F%20Tumulus">Karakuş Tumulus</a>".
